segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We return to Dol-Makjar. The year, however, is not the year 71. Our year, deep in the evening time, is the year 53, some 18 years before our story began.
segments.summary: Setting the scene 18 years in the past

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Liam, could you describe the state that we find Halandil Fang at at around 2:30 in the morning in The Rookery?
segments.summary: DM asks Liam to describe Halandil's current state

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Right. This is a beleaguered, good-spirited, tired, hopeful young man in the home in The Rookery that is less lived-in, as the table is used to, not as many years, and everyone's asleep in the house. Elodie is asleep upstairs. My son and my daughter, Alogar and Shadia, are asleep upstairs. The only people awake in the house right now are me and my infant daughter, Hero, who is, been crying for the last 20 minutes and we have just been making the rounds in the sitting room downstairs, in a room where one day I will say goodbye to my brother, but not tonight.
segments.summary: Halandil describes his younger self caring for crying baby Hero while family sleeps

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (bawling)
segments.summary: Baby Hero crying sound

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: (shushing) Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey. Hey, hey, hey, hey, hey. Hey. Hey, you're making a lot of noise. A lot of noise.
segments.summary: Halandil trying to soothe crying baby Hero

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Go ahead and give me persuasion, but I'll ask you to use your wisdom instead of your charisma because there's just no charming a baby who's this upset.
segments.summary: DM asks for persuasion roll using wisdom

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Sure, sure. I'm even going to self-impose disadvantage. It's one in the morning. This is the fourth night of this. That is a nine and that's a five. So you said my wisdom?
segments.summary: Liam rolls with self-imposed disadvantage

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Or instead of using your charisma, you will use your wisdom, but you will add any proficiency in persuasion. Same rules as always, I think. Unless you think at this point in his life, Hal is not as good a bard as he will be later.
segments.summary: DM clarifies mechanics and suggests younger Hal might be less skilled

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yeah, let's say that. Let's say that. I'll pause on that. So we'll just call that a 15.
segments.summary: Liam agrees and settles on result of 15

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: On a 15, the cries go down slightly into a sustained whimper, and in that way that you can tell when someone is about to sneeze, you know that you're just in the eye of the storm. You maybe have 30 seconds, a minute before the cries start up again. You're so tired.
segments.summary: Baby calms slightly but Halandil knows it's temporary

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That a girl, that a girl. You are my Hero. My Hero.
segments.summary: Halandil affectionately speaks to his daughter

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (licking) Just working at her tongue and trying to see shapes and light. Outside, you hear: (horseshoes clopping swiftly) Footsteps to the door. (pounding) "Hal!"
segments.summary: Baby Hero explores while someone arrives urgently outside

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: That's my-- Brother's voice? Okay. So I lay her, laying down face first, chest-first down over the shoulder, and I go to the door. Thjazi, what are you doing? What are you doing here so late?
segments.summary: Halandil recognizes his brother Thjazi's voice and goes to answer

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Opening the door, outside in the street, a snow-white steed of House Royce, silver embroidery on its bridle, a brown leather saddle with runes in Sylvan inscribed around the outside. Wearing a regal coat of emerald green, silver brocade, you see that there is a hanging pendant with the tree and key of House Royce around it as Thjazi, with the Liar's Blade at his side, rings bedecking his fingers, looks, bloodshot eyes, exhausted like he's been riding for days.
segments.summary: Thjazi arrives on ornate House Royce horse, looking exhausted and wealthy

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Is this the first time I've seen this horse?
segments.summary: Liam asks about the horse

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The first time you've seen this horse. You've seen him probably once since his wedding when he was coming here with his Lady wife on business. And maybe he invited you to a gala and then came and wanted to go out drinking at a neighborhood bar with you. That was probably five months ago, was the last time you saw him.
segments.summary: DM explains this is the first time seeing the horse and when Halandil last saw Thjazi

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Okay. Nice ride. Get in here.
segments.summary: Halandil comments on the horse and invites Thjazi inside

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: Okay.
segments.summary: Thjazi agrees to come inside

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Everyone's asleep except for us. Keep it down.
segments.summary: Halandil reminds Thjazi to be quiet

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: (speaks foreign language) He says to the horse. And you see the horse whips its head and the reins whip around the post outside your house.
segments.summary: Thjazi speaks to the magical horse which ties itself up

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Oh, nifty.
segments.summary: Halandil impressed by the horse's magic

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: (panting) Hi. It's happening. Something's happening. Hal, I-I-I needed to come and talk to you. I feel like I'm losing my mind. I feel like I'm losing my mind.
segments.summary: Thjazi urgently explains something is happening and he's distressed

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Sit down, sit down, sit down. And I--
segments.summary: Halandil tries to calm Thjazi

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh! Oh! She's beautiful, Hal!
segments.summary: Thjazi notices baby Hero and compliments her

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Are you awake enough to hold?
segments.summary: Halandil asks if Thjazi can hold the baby

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes! Yes, yes, yes. If you have any water, I would take water, but--
segments.summary: Thjazi agrees to hold baby and asks for water

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yeah, well, I'll trade you. You take her. I'll get the water. This is your uncle. Here you go.
segments.summary: Halandil hands baby to Thjazi and introduces him as uncle

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: Hi! Oh, sweet babe.
segments.summary: Thjazi greets baby Hero affectionately

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: I'm going to roll with disadvantage in front of the board. What's your wisdom score, can I ask? Thjazi's is an 11. Five plus just the proficiency and persuasion. She goes, (crying) He goes, Oh, ah, ah-- I don't know how-- She just, she doesn't know me.
segments.summary: Thjazi fails to calm baby Hero who starts crying

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: I come beelining back in with the water. Here, here, trade me, trade me, trade me, trade me, trade me.
segments.summary: Halandil rushes back to trade baby for water

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: You know I love you. Okay, goodbye.
segments.summary: Thjazi says goodbye to baby Hero

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Mama's sleeping. Mama's sleeping, okay? Come on, come on, come on.
segments.summary: Halandil soothes baby Hero mentioning mama is sleeping

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: Is Elodie-- Elodie's upstairs?
segments.summary: Thjazi asks about Elodie's location

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Yeah. Yeah, everyone's upstairs. They'd love to see you. Are you staying?
segments.summary: Halandil confirms everyone is upstairs and asks if Thjazi is staying

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: They arrested Mara Weaver, the Cormoray. I was in the hall in the Golden Orchard, and Aranessa was talking to them. I mean, they disbanded the Druidic Council. Hal, they're all-- And the Revolutionary Council's not saying anything. Have you heard anything? What is the Council saying? What are people in Dol-Makjar saying?
segments.summary: Thjazi reveals arrests and political upheaval involving multiple councils

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: This is the first I'm hearing about it. You rode straight here? How long have you been on the road?
segments.summary: Halandil learns of events for first time and asks about travel

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: (sighs) Took about two days. Listen, I-- Get this off of me! The-- Loza, Teor, all of them have been called up.
segments.summary: Thjazi says he traveled two days and mentions others being called up

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: Okay. (exhales deeply) That's a good horse.
segments.summary: Halandil notes the impressive travel time

segments.speaker: Thjazi (Brennan)
segments.content: Good horse. In Baladri, they got called up. Loza sent me a message that the Kagrikova, the High Council in Kavros, they-- There was a conversation around demonic influence and they were talking about it. And they've come out with a ban on warlocks of any kind traveling on the Underroad. It doesn't matter, fae-- I mean, there are people in Telmora who have agreements with the fairies, like, 'We'll leave out offerings for you and in exchange, we get some spells.' I mean, it's not-- It's a problem that's this narrow, and they're coming, crashing into it like an avalanche.
segments.summary: Thjazi explains warlock ban and broader political implications

segments.speaker: Halandil Fang (Liam O'Brien)
segments.content: What's Telmora going to do?
segments.summary: Halandil asks about Telmora's response

segments.speaker: Liam O'Brien (Halandil Fang)
segments.content: Thjazi.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Yeah?"

segments.speaker: Liam O'Brien (Halandil Fang)
segments.content: Don't go.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I do what I wish. See you next time, brother." (whooshes) And races out down the street. The memory fades. You, your love, your child, and the vanishing noise of hoofsteps.
segments.summary: Thjazi dismisses his brother's plea and departs, ending the memory

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: We'll continue this story of this family and the world they inhabit on tonight's episode of Critical Role.
segments.summary: Episode transition

segments.content: Keep.

segments.content: Keep.

segments.content: Ooh!

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Riesingürtle. You see a gate before you, trade streaming in and through. There are some gate guards moving to and fro, mostly checking in with people, taking names. Very few carriages are being actually inspected. And of course, you're not traveling with any cargo. So you see that mostly people are giving names to the guards at the gate. As you approach, what do you do?
segments.summary: The party approaches the gates of Riesingürtle, where guards are checking names of travelers

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Okay, for the few of us who maybe don't want to mention their last names.
segments.summary: Thaisha suggests they need pseudonyms for those with recognizable names

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: That would seem ill-advised.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees using real names would be unwise

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah. It's been a couple days. Have you thought of a pseudonym?
segments.summary: Thaisha asks if Occtis has prepared a false name

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Right. Let's-- I'll have one ready. I'll have one.
segments.summary: Occtis says he'll come up with a pseudonym

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, you're going to find it in the moment.
segments.summary: Aabria comments on Alexander improvising

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah, just give me a minute. I hadn't even thought about that. Like, I've never had to be anybody else.
segments.summary: Alexander admits he hadn't planned a pseudonym

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: I pull my cloak a little tighter on my face. Unless I see someone I recognize it's best perhaps I have a low profile as well.
segments.summary: Julien covers his face and suggests keeping a low profile

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Yeah. I, yeah. I mean, I'm not that recognizable, am I? Okay. I get it, no, I get it, I get it.
segments.summary: Occtis realizes he might be recognizable and needs to disguise himself

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I have a question.
segments.summary: Vaelus asks a question

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Maybe put the Pin away.
segments.summary: Thaisha suggests Occtis hide Pin

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I can disguise myself.
segments.summary: Occtis says he can disguise himself

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Does he look any different? Upon looking at him, does he seem off?
segments.summary: Vaelus asks if Occtis looks different or undead

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: Slash dead.
segments.summary: Vaelus clarifies she's asking if he looks dead

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Not at night. Not at night, not far away. I would say under starlight here in the high mountains, the pallid tenor of Occtis' flesh doesn't register as particularly noticeable.
segments.summary: Brennan explains Occtis's undead appearance isn't noticeable at night in the mountains

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: I do, well, those who you did see me when I was still alive, so you will notice that I am a little gaunter than I was and the eyes have ever so slightly a glow to them of green, the eyes have ever so slightly a glow to them of green, but it could be light.
segments.summary: Occtis describes his undead changes - gauntness and green glowing eyes

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I was mostly worried about Pin. It's the buttons.
segments.summary: Thaisha explains her concern about Pin being recognizable

segments.speaker: Occtis Tachonis (Alexander Ward)
segments.content: Okay, well, I'll do my best to put him away. He doesn't always stay.
segments.summary: Occtis agrees to hide Pin but notes Pin doesn't always obey

segments.speaker: Sir Julien Davinos (Matthew Mercer)
segments.content: Thaisha, do you mind interfacing with the guards?
segments.summary: Julien asks Thaisha to speak with the guards

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Yeah, not a problem. I was just checking in case you wanted to contribute on the trip. I've got it. You good?
segments.summary: Thaisha agrees to handle the guards

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley)
segments.content: I'm good. I think our best bet would be if you're our face for the moment.
segments.summary: Vaelus agrees Thaisha should be their spokesperson

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Great. Sounds good. And yeah, will push my horse slightly farther forward.
segments.summary: Thaisha moves forward to speak with the guards

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Mm-hmm, you see the serf wearing a breastplate and chainmail holding long pole arms. You see these tall halberds. One of the guards looks up to you and says, "Good evening, traveler, welcome to Riesingürtle. What business brings you to the fair city?"
segments.summary: A guard greets Thaisha and asks about their business in the city

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, just passing through on my way farther north. Just left Dol-Makjar. And I'm going to lower the hood of my cloak. And I think there's that little bit of ruffle. And I think there's that little bit of ruffle. I don't think I have any insignia of the Old Path on me beyond-- Yeah, no, I don't think I have any of it showing. But I'm curious to see how far I can get without having to name drop-- the Path.
segments.summary: Thaisha says they're traveling north from Dol-Makjar and tries to avoid mentioning the Old Path

segments.speaker: Guard (Brennan)
segments.content: So you merely mean to pass through with you and your companions? How many of you are here?
segments.summary: The guard asks about their party size

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Just the four of us.
segments.summary: Thaisha initially says four people

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Sorry, five.
segments.summary: Brennan corrects the count

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, five. Thank you. I forgot about Aranessa.
segments.summary: Thaisha corrects to five people, having forgotten Aranessa

segments.speaker: Guard (Brennan)
segments.content: Ah, very well. What business takes you north of here, once you pass through Riesingürtle?
segments.summary: The guard asks about their destination north of the city

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, a lie. I didn't think of one before. Okay, we find it in the moment. Oh (grunts). Got to name druid stuff. You could just see. Everyone can see her freeze immediately. (laughs) Meeting of druids, druid meeting, meeting of druids.
segments.summary: Aabria struggles to come up with a lie and settles on a druid meeting

segments.speaker: Guard (Brennan)
segments.content: You walk the Old Path?
segments.summary: The guard asks if Thaisha follows the Old Path

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: I do. Fuck! I do.
segments.summary: Thaisha admits she follows the Old Path

segments.speaker: Guard (Brennan)
segments.content: Then you are, in fact, a cousin of all of us. Please, this way, my lady.
segments.summary: The guard welcomes Thaisha as a fellow Old Path follower

segments.speaker: Guard (Brennan)
segments.content: Oh, your name that we might register it.
segments.summary: The guard asks for Thaisha's name

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Thaisha Lloy.
segments.summary: Thaisha gives her real name

segments.speaker: Guard (Brennan)
segments.content: And those of your companions?
segments.summary: The guard asks for the companions' names

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh, oh, mm, okay. One look over my shoulder to check with Aranessa to see if I should mention her name at all.
segments.summary: Thaisha looks to Aranessa for guidance on names

segments.speaker: Nessa Fang (Brennan)
segments.content: Ah, Nessa Fang.
segments.summary: Aranessa gives the name Nessa Fang

segments.speaker: Nessa Fang (Brennan)
segments.content: And this is my cousin, Marco.
segments.summary: Nessa introduces Julien as her cousin Marco

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Is this a room or is it just an alcove?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: There is one bed in here. There's a door into the space. There is a window. The window is looking at the exterior wall of the building next to this building and the distance between buildings is about 11 inches. Open the window. Just reach out, touch that other wall.
segments.summary: Description of cramped inn room

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Well, we can leave things here and lock the door.

segments.speaker: Matt (Julien)
segments.content: Were we given a key to--

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You were given a key to your room. Aranessa looks and says, "Ah-- I don't know how safe we are."
segments.summary: Aranessa expresses concerns about safety

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Absolutely not. Where are our-- Did we come on horses? Where are they--?

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Where are our horses moved to?

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: We floated in.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Aranessa looks and says, "I'll take care of the horses, it's all right." She walks downstairs with you and says, "Thaisha, would you just bring some food back for me there?"
segments.summary: Aranessa offers to handle horses and requests food

segments.speaker: Thaisha Lloy (Aabria Iyengar)
segments.content: Oh sure.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: The truth, Occtis, is I know that your condition is very frightening, but also you've been in Dol-Makjar for five years and you don't look like you're 15. I think that you will be able to pass a little bit more unseen than I would. People will recognize me.
segments.summary: Aranessa explains why Occtis should go out instead of her

segments.speaker: Alexander (Occtis)
segments.content: Yeah, that makes sense.

segments.speaker: Vaelus (Ashley Johnson)
segments.content: How old are you?

So she looks and goes-- Tree branches flow from her wrists and a small number of apples appears as she starts to hand them to the horses and starts to whisper into their ears. You see the horses just clop down the street a little bit, and she just puts their reigns over a small unlit wall sconce and leaves them there, doesn't know how to tie knots, and says, "I know how to talk to horses, but I can't tie knots."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Around the corner, you see that there's some lively music coming from a well-lit area with warm, many-candled chandeliers inside, long banquet tables. Unlike Dol-Makjar that has a lot of finer dining establishments, this place seems very folksy. Long banquet tables. There appears to be a culture where people are talking to other groups of people inside that they did not come here with because everything is, the tables are too large for any one party to take up a majority of it. You see there's a massive banquet counter in the back with huge open flame ovens and stones that people are cooking on the fire and just serving things up.
segments.summary: Description of the tavern's communal atmosphere

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You also see that no one at the food area is taking any money. It appears that all the food is free and people are paying for the ale over at this massive wall of oaken barrels. You see that there are huge wooden tankards coming up that are being pounded in front of people, big foamy heads of ale here. You see that there are a number of people in and around that are human, dwarven, and a lot of people that you actually see have human and dwarven parentage that appear to have a shared interest in this big brewer's counter. There are many different dwarven clan imprints on the barrels and many different human houses on the barrels, and people appear to be ordering from different ones of them.
segments.summary: Description of tavern's free food and paid alcohol system

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hung over the barrels on top is an enormous horn. It appears to be a natural formed horn, but it's about five feet long and you see that it hangs over there and there is a bell hanging next to it with a rope that goes down behind the bar. You see that it appears to be that people are sitting here feasting, drinking, talking to each other. What do you guys do? There are many also double doors coming into this massive garden of tables here.

It is specifically the family, House Halovar. Stepping in, there is what looks to be a couple of guardian soldiers, tabards with the house symbol on. They walk over, not unusual to see any of the Sundered Houses walking around, especially in a place like this that's off the main drag in Riesingürtle. There is a beautiful young woman dressed in the manner of a lux, meaning a church or chapel leader within the Candescent Creed. She walks in.

That handmaiden has proven that we have become lax. It is my intention to release your men and servants at once, your carriages as well. I would ask that you remain here with them in my castle for some time until we can straighten all of this out.
